CUSTOM_USER_INPUT.subject: REQUIRED: Describe your subject (person, object, scene, location)
CUSTOM_USER_INPUT.action: REQUIRED: What is happening or what movement is occurring
CUSTOM_USER_INPUT.setting: REQUIRED: Where does this take place (location, environment, context)
CUSTOM_USER_INPUT.narrative_intent: OPTIONAL: The emotional tone or purpose (e.g., 'with quiet determination', 'conveying isolation')

dialogue_staging_techniques.description: SELECT ONLY if scene involves dialogue between characters

shot_distances.description: SELECT ONE: How close is the camera to the subject
options: Medium Close Up (MCU) - chest to head
Medium Full Shot (MFS) - knees and up
Full Shot (FS) - entire figure with feet
Long Shot (LS) - figure with ample background
Extreme Long Shot (ELS) - vast landscape, small or absent figure

camera_angles.description: SELECT ONE: Vertical angle of camera relative to subject
options: Bird's Eye View - god-like overhead perspective
Worm's Eye View - extreme upward angle

composition_principles.description: OPTIONAL: SELECT if specific compositional approach is needed

framing_precision.description: OPTIONAL: SELECT for specific framing instructions
options: negative space to the left of frame
negative space to the right of frame

basic_movements.description: SELECT ONE or NONE: How does the camera move
options: tracking shot - camera follows subject laterally
panning shot - camera rotates horizontally on axis
tilting shot - camera rotates vertically on axis
dolly forward - camera moves toward subject
dolly backward - camera moves away from subject
crane shot - camera moves vertically on crane
orbital shot - camera circles around subject

combination_movements.description: OPTIONAL: SELECT for complex camera moves
options: Dolly Zoom (Vertigo Effect) - dolly + zoom in opposite directions
Circular Tracking Shot - smooth 360 degree circle
Arc Shot - camera moves in curved path
Tracking shot with a pan - lateral move + rotation
Crane with tilt - vertical movement + angle change
rack focus - shift focus from foreground to background
deep focus - everything in frame sharp
shallow focus - only subject in focus, background blurred
soft focus - deliberate blur for dreamy effect

movement_quality.description: OPTIONAL: SELECT to define movement style
options: whip pan - very fast horizontal rotation
High Key lighting - bright, even, low contrast
Low Key lighting - dark, high contrast, dramatic shadows
Rembrandt lighting - triangle of light on cheek
Butterfly lighting - light above and in front
Three-Point lighting - key, fill, back lights
dramatic lighting - strong contrasts and shadows
soft diffused lighting - gentle, even illumination
practical lighting - visible light sources in scene
silhouette lighting - backlit subject, dark foreground

time_of_day.description: OPTIONAL: SELECT for natural light quality

color_theory.description: OPTIONAL: SELECT for color palette approach
options: monochromatic color scheme - single color variations
saturated color palette - vivid, intense colors
desaturated and muted colors - subdued, faded
teal and orange color grading - cinematic standard
warm color palette - reds, oranges, yellows
cool color palette - blues, greens, purples
high contrast color - bold color separation

atmospheric_effects.description: OPTIONAL: SELECT to add environmental texture
options: volumetric fog - thick visible fog with light rays
heavy rain - visible rain and water effects
anamorphic lens flares - horizontal light streaks
natural lens flares - sun or light reflections
bokeh - out of focus light circles
neon light reflections - colorful reflections on surfaces

lens_types.description: OPTIONAL: SELECT for specific lens focal length
options: 14mm fisheye lens - extreme wide, spherical distortion
16mm ultra wide-angle - very wide field of view
50mm natural perspective lens - mimics human eye
anamorphic lens - widescreen with characteristic flares

optical_characteristics.description: OPTIONAL: SELECT for specific lens properties
options: shallow depth of field - strong background blur
deep depth of field - everything in focus
beautiful bokeh - smooth out of focus areas
pronounced lens flare - visible light artifacts
minimal lens flare - clean optical rendering
sharp corner to corner - edge to edge sharpness
dreamy soft edges - soft focus periphery
shot on 35mm film - standard cinematic film look
shot on 16mm film - grainier, documentary feel
shot on Super 8 - home movie aesthetic
IMAX 70mm quality - maximum resolution and clarity
Kodak Portra 400 color science - warm film tones
vintage 1970s film stock look - faded retro aesthetic
vintage 1980s film stock - nostalgic color shift
crisp digital Arri Alexa look - clean digital cinema
Sony Venice color science - modern digital
VHS tape aesthetic - lo-fi retro video

resolution_quality.description: OPTIONAL: SELECT for output quality markers

options: ramping speed effect - slow to fast or reverse

editing_techniques.description: OPTIONAL: SELECT for multi-shot sequences only
options: match cut on action - cut during movement
match cut on composition - similar framing
insert shot of a key detail
montage sequence showing passage of time
graphic match - similar shapes across cut

transitions.description: OPTIONAL: SELECT for how shot begins or ends
options: smooth dissolve - gradual blend between shots
smash cut to a loud scene - abrupt shock
whip pan transition - blur between shots

montage_theory.description: OPTIONAL: SELECT for conceptual editing approaches (multi-shot only)
options: implicational montage - create symbolic meaning between shots
intellectual montage - combine shots to form new idea
metric montage - cuts at regular intervals
tonal montage - emotional consistency across shots

sora_2_pro.prompt_template: Establishing wide shot of [scene], slowly pushing into a medium shot of [subject] doing [action], then cutting to close-up of [detail], rack focus to [second_detail]. [technical_specs], [transitions_note].

model_specific_implementation.veo_3_json: Use the 'negative_prompt' field in JSON structure
model_specific_implementation.kling: Add to main prompt with 'avoid', 'without', or 'do not use' phrasing
model_specific_implementation.sora: Be explicit about what you want (e.g., 'very focused and crisp' instead of 'not blurry')
model_specific_implementation.wan: Focus on positive descriptors for dialogue quality

manual_prompting.step_1: Start with CUSTOM fields (subject, action, setting)
manual_prompting.step_2: SELECT shot distance and angle from layer2
manual_prompting.step_3: Add camera movement from layer3 if needed
manual_prompting.step_4: SELECT lighting and atmosphere from layer4
manual_prompting.step_5: Add technical specs from layer5 for final shots
manual_prompting.step_6: Use layer6 only for multi-shot sequences

generative_app_development.input_collection: Use CUSTOM fields as user input forms
generative_app_development.option_selection: Present SELECT options as dropdowns or multi-select
generative_app_development.template_assembly: Programmatically combine user inputs with selected techniques
generative_app_development.model_adaptation: Reference model_specifics to customize output per platform
generative_app_development.validation: Ensure REQUIRED fields are populated before generation

usage_notes.for_manual_users: CUSTOM fields require your creative input. SELECT fields offer proven techniques you can choose from or ignore.
usage_notes.for_app_developers: CUSTOM fields map to text inputs. SELECT fields map to dropdown/checkbox UI. Structure enables both simple and complex prompt generation.
usage_notes.flexibility: Not every field is needed for every prompt. Start minimal, add complexity as needed.
usage_notes.learning_path: Master layers 1-2 first (subject + framing), then add 3-4 (movement + lighting), finally 5-6 (technical + editing) for hero shots.
